topic.title: Restarting a Ceph RADOS Gateway Node
topic.abstract: Steps for restarting a RADOS Gateway node.If you have one or more RADOS gateway nodes, these steps will assist you restarting.

section.title: Rebooting Ceph RADOS Gateway nodes
section.p: Use the following steps to rebooting a RADOS Gateway node. These steps apply for a dedicated cluster nodes, monitor cluster nodes or controller nodes:

If you need to reboot more than one RADOS Gateway nodes, reboot one node at a time to make sure the service is available during reboot.
Reboot the node.
When available, SSH into the node, allowing an additional minimum of five minutes for the node to settle.
Execute the following commands to start the services on the node:cd ~/scratch/ansible/next/hos/ansible ansible-playbook -i hosts/verb_hosts hlm-start.yml --limit <radosgw-node>
Execute the following commands to verify the status of all services on the node:cd ~/scratch/ansible/next/hos/ansible ansible-playbook -i hosts/verb_hosts hlm-status.yml --limit <radosgw-node>
When above start operation has completed successfully, proceed to the next RADOS Gateway node. Do not begin the reboot procedure for the next RADOS Gateway node until the reboot of the previous RADOS Gateway node has been completed successfully, that is, after the verb_hosts hlm-status.yml playbook has completed without error.
